docs.snippet: A feverish movement in the Canadian dollar based on the rumor of an upward revaluation to parity with the American dollar jolted an otherwise languid market for that unit last week.
docs.lead_paragraph: A feverish movement in the Canadian dollar based on the rumor of an upward revaluation to parity with the American dollar jolted an otherwise languid market for that unit last week.

docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 5--A "steadily growing program of direct technical assistance for the economic development of the countries of Latin America" under the auspices of the United Nations was forecast here this morning by David Owen, Assistant Secretary-General of the United Nations for economic affairs.

docs.snippet: Sixteen naval officers of six Latin-American nations arrived yesterday at the New York Naval Shipyard in Brooklyn for three weeks of study of Navy Yard procedures, ordnance and electronics. They came from Annapolis, where half of them had completed...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sixteen naval officers of six Latin-American nations arrived yesterday at the New York Naval Shipyard in Brooklyn for three weeks of study of Navy Yard procedures, ordnance and electronics. They came from Annapolis, where half of them had completed one year and the others two years of engineering courses in the United States Naval Academy.

docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 6--Despite the importance of expanded trade among the nations of Latin America as a means of lessening restrictions and controls on imports from other areas, such intra-regional trade has "deteriorated" during the past four years.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 1 7--The one British and two United States packing houses that handle the bulk of Uruguay's meat exports announced in large newspaper advertisements today that financial difficulties were forcing them to suspend all cattle...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 1 7--The one British and two United States packing houses that handle the bulk of Uruguay's meat exports announced in large newspaper advertisements today that financial difficulties were forcing them to suspend all cattle buying, beginning next Monday.
